title: AirBnB
text: I’m new to AirBnB as a traveler and now a host. I like finding unique places to stay off the beaten path.  Some places like mine are pet friendly & offer free breakfast. Most are like being in a home away from home. You can book a treehouse, a yurt, a boat, a cabin, a mansion, an RV, a private campsite, or someone’s couch.  As a host, I enjoy reading my guestbook all the wonderful things that guests experienced during their stay. Walking to the two nearby waterfalls in Dunsmuir, CA or driving to the other 5 waterfalls are among the top adventures my guests write about.  Their stays have allowed me to be home with my grandfather to provide him 24 hour care. I’m glad to have had the time with him and proud to have kept him out of a nursing home. Thank you AirBnB guests!

title: If you don’t have a pic of your bathroom
text:
I will never book an Airbnb that doesn’t have a photo of the bathroom. Especially the tub/ shower situation. Not only is it hard for disabled people to choose a space when they can’t see the bathing options, but some of us book getaways solely for the opportunity to relax. If you don’t post your bathroom or a clear shot of the tub/ shower, I will never book a room with you. I’ll sleep in my car first.

One time we got scammed by a renter calling a remodeled upstairs a “whole apartment” they didn’t have a kitchen! No sink or anything just a microwave and table in the living room area. Lmaooooo! We had to stay there for 3 weeks and Airbnb offered us NOTHING. There is no way to communicate with people before you book to even see what some of the spaces look like that aren’t shown. Very risky. 

Moral of the story is check all the pics before you book and if it seems like it’s lacking something, don’t be surprised when it is!

title: Great company overall!
text: I love staying in airbnbs. Get a taste of the neighborhood your visiting, if you need multiple bedrooms and a kitchen then airbnb is a great value! I was double charged once by the app which could have been a serious problem but lickily I had the extra money in my acct. they estimated the return would take a few days but it actually went back in a few hours. One thing I wish the company would adjust would be when youre searching for a place to stay, there is a price listed in the main search but when you click on the place, the prices sometimes change. I also wish that the host had limits at how much they could raise their prime rate over their base rate. For a holiday for example, some places quadruple the price.. i think thats a little crazy depending on location/time of year.

title: Lost its charm along the way
text: When Airbnb started, it was a really great way for us to travel anywhere and find reasonable accommodations. But over the years, I have observed that this app mostly favors hosts and doesn’t really give affordable accommodations to guests anymore. We have had several issues with the property description and the actual property, but Airbnb would never hold the host responsible. This is the main reason why hosts are taking advantage and don’t even bother cleaning up the place anymore. When you ask for refund for things that were missing, you get bullied and harassed by the hosts (and a negative review on your profile) while all along they will sweet talk you into giving them a 5 star rating so that their local business is not affected. The app itself won’t work on LTE most of the times. With the tremendous cleaning fees that the host charge and the service fees of Airbnb, the quality of accommodations and service by Airbnb is laughable.

title: Customer service
text: Hi I just want to suggest to the developer of this app that all the charges should be transparent to the guests before having to confirm. For example recently I had to cancel my stay because the place wasn’t what I was expecting. For cancellation fee I was charged $1000 which I could only see after hitting the confirm to cancel button.  This shouldn’t be the case right because it’s like having to purchase an item without knowing the price. Also everything was on the host discretion. The only thing airbnb support could help is rehashing what the guests has said to the host. In my case the place I booked  was so run down that I couldn’t live there anymore. To help guests like me in the future airbnb should have a better policy and take actionable steps to refund their guests instead of just telling the guests to ask the host to refund which I see as very unreasonable because most hosts will be unwilling to do that regardless of the guests experience.

title: Do not use this app if you are a minority
text: Airbnb does not care if you are a person of color voicing a concern about a host. My Airbnb looked great on photos but once inside there were roaches, blood stains on floor, an oder out of this world and the police continued to show up at the locations I stayed even after I was moved to a different unit. The host who tried to scam me prior to moving by stating the room I booked was no longer available and they had a larger  room that was only $87 dollars more than the cost I had already paid. When the host sent over the new cost it showed $600 dollars more. I kindly declined the offer and requested that she refund me since I hadn’t moved in and it wasn’t pass the 24 hour period. The host refused and then stated “oh it looks like the room you booked is now available”. Be aware and be sure not to book a room with outpost. Airbnb will NOT HELP YOU GET YOUR MONEY BACK THEY WILL CONSTANTLY TRANSFER YOUR CASE TO ANOTHER PERSON EVERY DAY TO STALL ON TIME. THIS COMPANY DOES NOT CARE THAT PEOPLE OF COLOR ARE BEING PLACED IN THE HOOD AND POLICE ARE BARGING IN THE DOORS UNANNOUNCED.

title: Horrible Customer Service
text: Before you use Airbnb, know that you cannot contact their customer service if you have an issue. They can only contact you. My host canceled out on me at the last minute. I wanted to check in at 11am, but she told me to check in at 5pm. She canceled at 4pm, while on my way to hers. When you cancel on a host, you pay for the inconvenience. When a host cancels on you, Airbnb only offers you either your full refund, or an additional 10% of your fees if you choose to book another rental with Airbnb, even if it’s more expensive. All other options were more expensive at that time of day, and when they called me, they told me I had to wait for Shannon, who was my case manager, to get to work, even though I was stuck with nowhere to go in -2 degrees cold. I asked to speak with another case manager and was put on hold for 20mins. I sent another request to be called, and its been 24hours, no one has called back or emailed. Good luck using Airbnb when you’re stranded.

title: Deceitful practices
text: The host asks for ID information including pictures although I provided these to Airbnb already. Neither host nor Airbnb requires uploading this information before making a reservation. The host sends a link later. Who is responsible for security of the data I share with the host? Not Airbnb for sure. So why am I being arm twisted into sharing my personal information? On top of it, host wouldn’t respond. And Airbnb support took hours to respond on the day of my travel. Their contact center has the poorest audio quality on phone. Overall super frustrating experience and unsafe business practice. When Airbnb support finally responded, they offered me a partial refund because I failed to read a rule tucked under something called additional rules. Does Airbnb seriously expect people to read all their policies and every last rule? And if this rule is so important then why not make it mandatory BEFORE you take my money? Never using Airbnb again.

title: Such incredible customer service
text: I had a trip planned for NYC and the host cancelled at 9 pm the night before arrival due to “an emergency in the apartment”. I called Airbnb in a panic thinking I’d be homeless in NYC trying to celebrate my 21st birthday. They not only gave me a full refund on my trip they helped cover the new place since I wouldn’t have the refund to cover it for 5-10 business days and I am a college student on a tight budget. All I can say is I am so grateful for Airbnb and their amazing customer service support team for making my birthday trip possible once more. You all (and especially Jade!!) were incredible and I can’t say enough good things. If you’re worried about the risk of an Airbnb cancelling on you-know Airbnb will go above and beyond to make things right. Thank you all!!!

title: Terriable support service for cancelations due to COVID
text: As an Airbnb host and traveler I used to be a big fan of the company.. until coronavirus hit and the service department went quiet. We had two reservations affected by travel restrictions and the Airbnb support team were of little to no help.  Our first reservation for March 17 should have fallen under the COVID policy however we were told “we canceled the reservation too early”, this should have been grandfathered into the policy. The second reservation was for our wedding (which was canceled) after me (the bride) was diagnosed with COVID in July. I even sent in a letter from my doctor but received no refund or follow up. In total, I called Airbnb support about 6 times and spent over 8 hours on hold. When I did get through the best they could do was “mark my case as urgent”. We never got a message or a call back from Airbnb. I am very disappointed by the support service we received with airbnb and will not be hosting for this company any more after how they are treating travelers.

title: Some nice features are gone
text:
I used to love the feature where users can click the monthly/daily fee and see a total fee with a chosen time period, now clicking on the monthly fee of a listing does not lead to anything. For some reason now users cannot see their total amount before reserving a place. This is really inconvenient because the actual total fee is A LOT more expensive than monthly/daily fee multiplies the number of months/days, making it hard for users to plan ahead for their budget before making a decision. 

Another thing is that whenever I go back to my previously saved filters, it won’t work. The UI would make me to choose the date, place to stay and other filters all over again. This just makes the saved filters meaningless. 

Other than that, I think it’s a pretty good app for people looking for short-term stays.

title: I travel because of AirBnb
text: My girlfriend and I used this app for the first time ever during a trip to Chicago. We went for the Lollapalooza festival and being from Colorado, had absolutely no clue of what Chicago was like. We were really happy to find an app that could give us access to such CHEAP housing for a trip that could’ve cost us five times as much as what we paid! We’re both college students still saving for our education and would’ve never been able to do this trip without AirBnb. I recommend this app to anyone and everyone who wants to explore the world! I have never been happier with an experience, and I’ve met so many amazing people because of it. Thank you so much for giving me the opportunity to see the world on a reasonable budget for me!! :)

title: Love Airbnb’s platform and their service
text: You know you’ve created a great service when it becomes a verb!  Today, we “airbnb” as both travelers and as hosts!  Two of our favorite world travel experiences:  Capri, Italy and Manchester, Vermont.  In addition, coast-to-coast in America we host: at Asante Sana in Kennebunkport, Maine and Casa al Mare in San Francisco, California.  Try both traveling this way and hosting!  You’ll love this wonderful way of experiencing the world, meeting fabulous people, and sharing your unique creations.  We host - in great part - to give a % of our earnings to the Rugged Elegance Philanthropies that we support each year.  Of the 40 that we support we get to know our guests a bit. We narrow to three non-profits to support.  And then they pick the one!  10% of our Airbnb earnings go to do further good in the world!

title: Discover Porto’s Hidden Treasures tour
text:
If you visit Porto, be sure to make a reservation for this 3 hour walking tour with Sergio. We had such an enjoyable day today with Sergio, our very knowledgeable friendly host who took us around the city and explained the amazing background of this very old city. He can speak many different languages so fluently so that French speaking visitors and English speaking visitors in our group learned so much and could ask him questions. He was so kind to take a group photo and some individual photos and send them to us along with recommendations for different restaurants to try. We enjoyed our stop at a small restaurant to sample port wine and pastries. We highly recommend this excellent and very reasonable tour with Sergio.
Christina and Jerry Costa
September, 2019

title: Airbnb left me high and dry.
text:
Its a good experience when thing go right, but when things go wrong, it really goes wrong. Expect that customer service cannot help you. Expect customer service to reassure you that thing will be able to be resolved. Then hours  later They have no power to authorize anything. They will always side with the property owner even when they are wrong. And finally when they have you in a corner, they will charge you again for airbnb service charge. To what service I'm still not sure.

Lets just say try VRBO if you want something fair resolved when the 3rd party needs to be involved to resolve something between renter and owner. 

If you are lucky you wont have any problems and continuing using airbnb. I was the last 8 times. But expect if anything goes wrong expect to make all of your arrangements on your own. Support will only communicate to you 24 hrs at a time. And if your okay with that,use this service. If not VRBO and flipkey are good alternatives.

title: SCAM ALERT
text:
If a hosts kicks you out of your room you’ve paid for before hand, ONLY VIDEO EVIDENCE can save you. So please be prepared to use a video camera if you find yourself in a scary situation with a host. 

In my situation, I complained to AIRBNB about the cleanliness of the stay and requested a refund. This was after the host being rude during my check in process. The host was then furious at the complaint and kicked me out of my room threatening police action. I left, and the host told AIRBNB I was lying and AIRBNB said they would only believe me if I had video evidence. In other words, airbnb will always side with the host unless you have video that will make them look bad in the press/social media. Multiple first hand accounts from multiple parties related and unrelated would not suffice, nor other details that would obviously show my side of the truth. 

AIRBNB will not try to make you whole again and there is no accountability without video evidence. Beware of abusive hosts

title: Bad
text: This was my first time using Airbnb and everything was okay until I left. Before leaving I made sure to clean everything. Did laundry cleaned the bathroom with bleach I even swept. We tipped the doorman and the girls who did laundry. Made sure everything was spotless. And our “Super host” sent us message saying we left the room a complete mess and that we had to pay $50. and sent a picture of a receipt and threatened us with a bad review. Mind you the Airbnb was in Colombia and the receipt was for like 10 thousand COP which is $4 in USD and she had the audacity to charge us $50. And when I called Airbnb support line to tell them this. They said we can’t do anything until she post a bad review. Cause In the policy Airbnb says that they don’t tolerate threats like that and when I asked about the policy they said “oh we have a lot of policy” all in all it was good until they got greedy and Airbnb letting this host probably get away this who knows how many times.

title: Host (WoCoHo) charged fees offsite
text: I booked my rental for December 24 to 28 through Airbnb. This host (WoCoHo) sent me a message that it will be extra fees to book this rental.  They asked me for my personal email and sent me an invoice,  which I came to know that it’s against Airbnb policy after contacting help center.I was not aware of the policy of not to pay any fees offsite until I contact Airbnb. For some unfortunate reason I had to cancel this rental one and a half month before. Since I canceled my rental way ahead I received my rental money back which was charged through Airbnb. I asked help center for additional fees ($1035) which was charged by host. They replied that I have to contact host and asked them for the refund. After sending so many messages one day I got reply that I will receive my refund in 3-5 days. It’s been 20 days and I haven’t received my money back. They have stoped replying my messages. Even though it was against Airbnb’s policy this host still doing business with them without getting penalized.

title: Such a good idea, wish a better company thought of it
text: Be careful and have a backup plan!!! They cancelled my reservation a week before my trip to Denver with a note saying let us know if we can help in any way. I said I could use help getting a new place to stay that’s not 200+ more a night than my original listing. They sent me one place with half the amount of beds and told me to send links to other places I would consider. I sent in links and got no response. I have been sending message after message explaining the original agent on the case is not responding. The response I get from that is that they are sending my case back to the agent that is not doing anything so he can deal with it. What kind of business cancels on a customer and then ghosts them after offering help? I can not express to you enough how important a back up plan is. List two places and cancel one a few days before.... it’s the only way to guarantee you don’t end up in my situation.

title: Horrible customer service
text: I recently booked a trip to Peru for the month of July. Gave deposit, everything seemed great. Went to log into the app one day (now 3 weeks ago) and I was locked out of my account. So of course I call asking to talk to someone to see what was going on. They said they would have someone email me. Days later.... still nothing. A week goes by and I call back again. This time, asking to speak to someone via the phone. Apparently they won’t allow it, but they assured I’d be placed at “top priority”. TWO MORE WEEKS go by, and I still have not heard a thing. My bank account was refunded the amount I spent on booking the place, which means that I now do not have a place because the people couldn’t get back to me. Called again. Nothing has changed. No answers. That is absolutely the worst customer service I’ve ever dealt with in my life. How do you not even send one email in weeks!? I’ve used the app before, but will not be doing it again. Horrible.

title: Some difficulty but overall positive !
text: Airbnb overall has been a very positive and successful tool in renting our home however some renters how a multitude of questions and there phone numbers are deleted from initial conversations. We understand that Airbnb wants to keep conversations within the system however sometimes this frustrates prospective renters trying to make choices quickly. Also, when communicating with renters who have booked, attachments have not been able to be sent through your system. We have a two page Welcome Package set up specifically for each renter with all the codes, directions and tips for them and we have not been able to include this on your website. Lastly, I have had to purchase a laptop computer as Airbnb doesn't seem compatible with iPad's.

title: Unable to access listing, with unresponsive host, money lost
text: I recently had a nightmare of an experience with Airbnb. The place I booked had self check in and when I opened the smart lock found two other people on the bed. They had no reservation and host claims they had broken in. It was late in the night in a thunderstorm so I had to pay a lot of money to find a nearby hotel instead to get a roof over my head. I asked the host for a refund, but they refuse and want me to go stay in their unsafe Airbnb instead, they changed the lock though so I cannot access it. I say I don’t want to go back and ask for a refund, host stops messaging me. I have been talking to Airbnb support and they have been giving me generic responses and telling me to talk to the host, who has ghosted me. No one is giving my money back and I continue to pay for a place I have no access to! Horrible app that doesn’t vet for safe places and quality hosts!!! DO NOT USE!!!!

title: One of the worst
text: Please be aware that this is one of the worlds, most notorious, misleading and deceptive apps on earth. I read an article recently were 70% of Airbnb employees are being allowed to walk off the stage soda say 50 to 90% of Airbnb customer so disappointed and some of them are just clearly ripped off Airbnb is notorious for having horrible tenants were wearing weapons being capable of all sorts of things, as well as judging people with a criminal record, and raising the eyebrow to the quality standards also the hidden fees that are known to go out the Airbnb are well known on Google news, groups and more. Please be very careful when booking an Airbnb, as you are more than likely to be a victim to some sort of rip off it is if it is not an extremely high priced Airbnb unit. this is a clear example of inflation, and you only get what you pay for. Don’t be lured into Airbnb low-cost rental as most of them are all rip offs, and most of them are fake listings.

title: I will never use AirBnB again
text: 3 days from the trip to PCB and the host says it’s no longer available. Customer service was terrible and REFUSED to help find alternate accommodations at anywhere near the same pricing. Was going to have to pay 4x the original amount to find anything in the area for those days. When asked for a supervisor after 5 different times calling and requesting I have yet to ever get so much as a call/text/letter from them expressing any kind of remorse for such a bad experience. It seems like company is so busy taking you over the coals for money they forgot to hire any level of customer support staffing. I’ve had plenty of good experiences and bad experiences with them before this too, but the last 2 occurrences were the last straw for me. Use them at your own risk, but be very cautious that you could lose all your money and they could care less. There’s VRBO and plenty other alternate sites out there for me to use.

title: Horrible
text: I was sexually harassed when I attempted to pull up to a hosts driveway. When the host came out in see-through underwear and exposed himself to me and my other female friend we were horrified and drove away as fast as we could in order to be safe. Many men kill women and they are never heard from again. In order to avoid a potential situation like this we did not attempt to contact the host. Once we did contact the host in order to ask him to cancel our reservation he posted a review calling me clinically insane and absolutely could be sued from the way he slandered my name. Airbnb and this silly man are so lucky I don’t have the time for a lawsuit right now because this is absolutely disgusting. This sexual predator is still able to be a host on Airbnb and I only received my money back after complaining for a week. I wonder what would have happened if that man had actually gone through with what he had planned to do that night… DONT TRUST AIRBNB!!!

title: Zero stars
text:
Stayed at Jay Kollmansberger and Robin Befus condo in Destin Florida. DO NOT GO UNLESS YOU HAVE NO CLEANLINESS STANDARDS. The most disgusting condo I have ever seen. The odor and blankets stunk so bad. Jay said not to leave a review and he would refund me the money as we did not stay a single night in his filthy place. Spoiler alert: Jay never refunded us, contacted Airbnb and sent them pictures of his nasty place and they gave us 145 dollars.....not 758 dollars that we spent on this stupid place. First and last time I will ever use Airbnb. Everyone I talk to and show pictures too say they will never stay at an Airbnb either now. Customer service is a huge part of a business and Airbnb clearly don’t care about the quality of the rooms they allow on their app. Don’t trust the deceitful pictures because my pictures are polar opposite of the listings. You couldn’t pay me to sleep in some sketchy condo like Jay and Robins.

Do yourself a favor and pay a little extra to stay somewhere where they actually care about your vacation.

title: SuperHost/Guest
text: As a 2 year Superhost I am extremely disappointed with my experience with Airbnb! I am cute in tears now and very hurt and distraught because I’ve been in the phone with Airbnb for 2 hours calling Apple Pay, my bank, and several Airbnb case managers. I made a reservation that turned out to be fraudulent in the listing details and the host never responded. A representative assured me of a refund and then of course the host responds. Now I am out of a place to stay, my flight refund, and the initial refund of canceled reservation. I have had no help with. The case manager, HERBERD, I am on hold with currently is ONLY concerned with recovering a loss with Airbnb, so much so that he lied and stated that a merchant is my bank, when we all know that is the person I made the transition with. Airbnb please update your information and the knowledge of you representatives because you are ruining ppls livelihood, it has happened to my guests and now me. I am very very disappointed. I will be going to VRBO to see what they offer.

title: Awful experience
text: We recently booked a little mini vacation to Vegas and booked an Airbnb because it’s usually more convenient than a hotel. upon arriving to the Airbnb we were greeted with dirty dishes all over the sink, unmade beds, open Food in the fridge, and a clogged bathroom sink with hair on it. about 15 minutes after we got there another family walked through the door and proceeded to tell us that they had booked the same place for the same day and time (very uncomfortable and awkward situation) after agreeing to leave and find somewhere else to stay, we waited in the lobby for about an hour trying to contact Support with no response. After about a week Support finally got back to me about issuing a refund. we figured the least they can do would be to provide us with a discount or possibly even cover our next Airbnb stay but they refused to do anything else besides issue a refund. Definitely expected more from such a large we’ll known company. Never again.

title: Be careful and take pictures of everything before and after you leave
text: My wife and I went on a honeymoon to Hawaii and decided to stay in an Airbnb. The place was great aside from the bed was very uncomfortable and we barley slept. They sent us an email at the end of our stay asking we do not leave a bad review rather tell them if we had any issues. We wanted people to know that we didn’t sleep well. They said we left the place very clean. However days after we left a review stating the bed was uncomfortable we receive a notice saying we broke blinds and tried sticking they back up with paper clips and tapes and stained a bunch of sheets which looked to be bleach. We were accused of damages we did not do. Even though we fought it and asked to have someone from Airbnb call us they denied calling us and just charged us. I’m beyond upset for being blamed for damages we did not cause. I’m even more upset they didn’t have the decency to give us a call back to talk to us. Crooked.

title: My first stay
text: Booking my first Airbnb the couple cancelled a few day prior because the marked the price to low. Than I booked a location I feel you can’t go off of peoples review because everyone said this place was great. When I got to the location I already noticed mold on the ceiling and it was right above the bed. A few nights later the roof collapsed in where the mold was. The homeowners were responsive but they probably should of go that fixed before trying to book people for a health risk. And I feel in all the pictures they took they angled it perfectly just to so you won’t see it. Also the place was infested with a couple of families of roaches. I’m still in the process of finding a new place. Airbnb sounds like a great App but just for the headache and price it’s a lot more convenient to stay at a known hotel surprisingly the price is not that far off. I just recommend to do your research and contact the homeowner to see if the location has any issues,

title: Do not recommend.    Hosts can scam guests
text: I was scammed by an Airbnb host for $1237 for damages that included pre-existing conditions and falsified charges. I contacted Airbnb Resolutions for assistance. They upheld the charges and did not consider my response. They reminded me that under their terms and conditions they can charge me for any damages caused during my stay. However, they obviously did not conduct a detailed review or even interview my guests. They only considered the hosts fraudulent claim as part of the determination process before charging me. I notified Airbnb that it was a scam and they failed to conduct a reasonable review. Airbnb also deleted my accurate and truthful review of the rental unit and my experience without my consent which clearly demonstrates that Airbnb’s marketing campaign and review policy are totally inaccurate and skewed to protect the host to the detriment of the client making Airbnb complicit to this scam. I will never utilize Airbnb in the future and highly recommend that you do not as well.

title: Roaches raining on you while you sleep?  No big deal.
text: I’ve used Airbnb on and off throughout the years and it has been hit or miss, but nothing compares to what I’ve just gone through. After having to flee a location because of a roach infestation outbreak in the middle of the night and not being compensated for anything but the remainder of the trip is appalling. I will be suing the host and possibly Airbnb for adequate compensation. You don’t know how it feels to be homeless in a foreign city until you’ve gone through it yourself. This debacle has added another $895 to the cost of my trip and Airbnb simply doesn’t care. Trying to find a hotel that allows pets the day of is a nightmare of its own. Buyer beware: Airbnb has absolutely no quality controls. I’m thoroughly convinced after multiple negative experiences and this horrific nightmare that Airbnb actively suppresses bad reviews; mine still hasn’t shown up…. I’ll obviously never use Airbnb again.

title: Poor oversight by Air BnB
text:
As for the business: Previously a good experience but on a recent extended stay reservation I felt defrauded. This app and company will not allow you to see the actual address until you book. Many times, with refund policies being determined by the hosts -you might book a place based on its location and find out after Airbnb takes your money that it is not located in the advertised area. Basically, Fraud. It should not be so difficult to get your money when the host is clearly misrepresenting the location of their unit. 
AirBNB is a company that gets your money and then makes it as hard and long as possible to rightfully get it back in hopes that you’ll just quit. 
As an app:  there is no way to delete messages or delete previous host messages that continually invite you to book. 
Its a serviceable app.  But Google “pitfalls of Airbnb” before you use it and especially before you book with it.

title: One of the worst applications that i have ever used. I’d give it a zero star or even less if i could
text:
Bad communication, no problem solving at all, no legitimacy at all, no rights protection for their guests at all, no humanity or sympathy. 
I feel like I’m dealing with robots, a company that is run by a bunch of robots, repeating the same phrases, sending similar emails and replys.
I am having the worst stay experience ever and i have been almost bagging them to find a solution for me, i even had to cry and they are just passing me from one representative to the other every single day without any action taken.
Noise, heater broken, rats in my room. I haven’t slept for nights while i am a pregnant woman staying alone, they haven’t even taken this into consideration. They are playing me every day with a different speeches, solutions that are contracting their terms and conditions. It is clearly mentioned in their terms that they will fully refund me or reallocate me somewhere else if it is health hazard related. A rat staying with a pregnant woman in the same room is a health hazard.
I’ve been waiting for 5 days for any solution, well until now nothing happened.
I have plenty of emails transferring me from one representative to the other without any action taken.
if something happens to me while I’m expecting my baby soon, i will definitely go to court with you.
YOU ARE THE WORST.

title: Host will cancel on you
text:
I was looking forward to my first time using Airbnb, my place was booked in Las Vegas to come visit my son who lives there. About 48 hours prior to my departure, my host canceled my reservation citing COVID concerns at the property. I checked with the resort property and they had none of those concerns mentioned by the host. He just canceled with no valid reason.
Being this is during spring break time and now being such short notice with less than 48 hours, this left me scrambling for a place to stay. Airbnb refunded my payment immediately however did not do much at all to help me book another place. In fact the customer support person told me it was the end of her shift and she would have to hand me off to another person. 
In the end I found a place on Vrbo, it was more expensive but the reservation was immediately confirmed by the actual property owner and not the so-called scammer host you find on Airbnb. That will be my one and only time attempting to use this service.

title: No accountability, unsafe to store credit card info!
text: Disappointing customer service experience. My account was notifying me of reservation bookings that was not me- naturally I was concerned my account was hacked and my credit card info was compromised. After promising a prompt response, I don't hear back for ~10 days and never received confirmation that my credit card info was safe. Customer service never accepted any guilt and told me to reach out to my phone provider to check if I was receiving notifications from a different Airbnb user account (as if it wasn't easier to verify and fix on their end if this truly was the issue rather than my account being compromised). It's a good platform but sad that with all the fees they take they're unable to have any accountability or customer-friendly policy when they're at fault. I recommend deleting any credit card information stored on the app, don't trust that Airbnb will protect your information or be there to provide help

title: Tried to make us stay in an unsafe environment
text: At the beginning of the pandemic (before we knew it had already reached the us), we had a trip planned to the bay. Our host cancelled on us on our way to the airport. In light of what has transpired these past 5 months, totally understandable. We went to rebook with someone who said we’d have a private bathroom. Upon discussing with the host turns out it was shared and connected to the rest of the house. We didn’t feel safe with this (and are especially glad we cancelled now). We had the reservation for all of 30 minutes before cancelling. Despite Airbnb having our first host cancel on us right before our flight, us being lied to in another post, and us being out in a potentially unhealthy predicament, Airbnb wouldn’t refund. We took the loss but this is a warning. Airbnb does not care about your safety. They are on the side of getting theirs and are on the side of the host - even if they are untruthful. If you want to go with Airbnb be careful.

title: Unsafe and potentially dangerous experience.
text: I’d often heard the rumors about Airbnb for years about how they just care about the money and don’t care about the safety or wellbeing of their customers. Unfortunately I felt that first hand yesterday. I told a host that his toilet seat was broken, his bedroom window didn’t close (in London) to make him aware of it and thought it better than telling him as soon as I was aware rather than when I left. He accused me of doing it and threatened me, said he was going to come to the house (a woman on my own). He became nasty when I told him I didn’t feel comfortable letting a man in while I was alone. I then got a knock on the door, I knew I had to get out of there ASAP! I contacted Airbnb 3 times in 24 hours. I’m yet to get a phone call from them. I received a text asking if I had stayed at the house, nothing more. Absolutely disgusted! I will be staying at hotels again from now on. I believe the stories about Airbnb now. If I could give 0 stars, I would.

title: Good overall but one major flaw
text: I’ve enjoyed the Airbnb app and haven’t had any problems until now. I’m currently in Japan and I can’t read Japanese. When you message your host you can choose to translate the conversation but every time you exit the inbox and re-enter it you have to retranslate the conversation. Which doesn’t sound like a problem until you’re driving around, lost in the dark and the rain and you have to constantly exit the inbox to get it to refresh. And then you have to wait those precious seconds waiting for the inbox to refresh AND pressing the translate button while potentially missing a turn as you’re host gives you directions. Obviously this is a very specific problem to have but if they have the capability of translating the conversation in the first place they should be able to keep it translated.

title: So far, so....?
text: For the most part Air BnB has been great, an easy platform to use and connect with guests to rent my home. My only issue is that their “great host protection” is kind of a joke. I had a guest ruin several expensive items in my home (a carpet and mattress) and I submitted photos and receipts within 12 hours of the guests departure for the replacements, which, due to the type of damage, had to be immediately replaced. It took nearly a month, of cycling through multiple people in Air’s resolution center, multiple messages, re-submission of photos and receipts and more messages out of my frustration and the result was Air telling me I needed a cleaning estimate for items I no longer had! The final ruling was they reimbursed me $155 on a $580 unexpected bill because I didn’t get a cleaning estimate. I rent my house to make extra money, not spend more. Big thumbs down for that portion.

title: Sad and Angry at Airbnb Policy
text: 6 years since we’ve had a real vacation together, we were really looking forward to our anniversary this year. We do not recommend Airbnb. It’s sad that in order to get a great place to stay on vacation with a good price you have to book so far in advance. But they can cancel on you at the last minute(it’s actually a week but our money will not be reimbursed for 7-15 business days.) You would think that their customer service would have options to help with this sort of thing.  They don’t. Airbnb assumes everyone has extra money to throw around. We asked for the money to be credited to our account so we could book another location, but we were told that it’s not their policy. Also, we can no longer find a listing to our specific needs due to it being so close to booking time. Airbnb really needs to find a way too ok put the customer first. Horrible service.

title: Corner cases, login and reset password flows are terrible
text:
While the base flow is exemplary, one star is put emotionally for not being able to reset a password (deep-linking does not work) and correctly add new phone numbers (no confirmations are received). So I'm not being able now to book an apartment because I can't change the settings for my account.

UPD1: finally dancing around, deleting, and logging out did the trick. But please folks test your app better for more use cases.

UPD2: decreasing the rating. Can't easily search for variants on an app that my wife prepared via email links and I look at them in Safari. Selfie camera for id photos is tilted when a photo is captured so you are getting offset photos all the time until you specifically tilt the camera in the opposite direction before making the photo.

title: The absolute worst
text: I have used AirBNB several times without issue and when it works, all is good. However, recently I had an issue where the host cancelled 2 weeks before my stay. The company guarantees that (and I quote) “if your cancellation happens within 30 days of check-in, we can also assist you in rebooking a comparable or better listing”. Not only is AirBNB unwilling to follow through on their commitment, but they won’t even call me back as they have promised 7 days in a row (I’m very persistent). Each day, I have called them seeking resolution and they have promised that an “ambassador” who can assist me will return my call within 24 hours. I have gotten 0 calls. They have been beyond unhelpful - they have been extremely disingenuous. I had always thought hat I had a contract with the host for my stay, booked 6 months before. But apparently, we’re in the Wild West where there are no rules or compensation. Book at your own risk.

title: Great idea! Bad execution.
text: Now being under 25, I understand the no party rule and system being extra careful. But I normally use this all when I’m going on vacation or just want a stay at home vacation. I love the idea of borrowing a home instead of being in unkept hotels because I absolutely hate them. I normally have others with me that are older like family members and family friends. Even when using some of their accounts, it still tries to say we are a party risk. I was able to get some airbnbs but unfortunately Airbnb is not serving it’s hotel alternative. The customer service is terrible sometimes. I only found one host who actually provided customer service that wasn’t hostile. He might’ve been on edge but he trusted us. Especially when we PROVED that we were great guests. Another thing is the unnecessary holds and fees and what not. It is ridiculous. I think I’ll be refraining from buying Airbnb until further notice.

title: LOCKED ACCOUNT
text: I downloaded the app and confirmed my identity, I never made a reservation but now here I am trying to make a reservation and my account is locked! With a message directing me to call. I called and no one can even tell me why my account is locked! They proceed to tell me that someone will contact me in the next few days but that he will mark the email as urgent. Four days go by and I hear nothing. So I call back and yep it’s the same bull crap, someone will contact me about my account being locked.... this is absolutely ridiculous! Considering I have never even used the account, what would warrant them to lock it? Did I search too much? Did I not travel quick enough for their liking? Here I am trying to book my trip and I can’t because of their own stupidity! I guess I’ll have to just book a hotel since they can’t get in contact with their customers in a timely manner. They can’t even transfer you to a supervisor! Unreal!not even worth the one star!

title: TERRIBLE SERVICE
text: I DO NOT recommend using Airbnb to reserve a vacation home! My friend and I tried to reserve an Airbnb for a work trip and we got nothing but unnecessary issues from this company. Every time we tried to reserve the house, it would give us a message about “Safety reasons unrelated to Covid-19.” Then, when we would go back and look at the listing, it was suddenly be unavailable. This has happened twice with 2 listings! Also, when we got in contact with customer service, they submitted a ticket and said she would get a call back. But, instead she got an email stating that she can never use Airbnb again due to fraudulent activity. However, there was no fraudulent activity being done. We had to use different people and different payment methods to reserve the home, because Airbnb failed to be specific about why we couldn’t reserve the listing. We will NEVER use this horrendous, unprofessional company EVER again! Thank you.

title: Use Anything Else
text: I had only negative experiences using this app, as well as the Airbnb website. I attempted to change my password, which led to many “error” and “unable to process your request” messages but ultimately I was able to log in after a period of time. I attempted to reserve a stay at a resort, only to have the screen freeze when I attempted to put in a contact phone number for myself. I restarted the app and did this again, as well as on my computer and not one time did it allow me to proceed. I gave up and closed my tabs, then when I checked my credit card account I noticed that Airbnb had charged my card and I never received confirmation in an email or on my account. My Airbnb account shows no record of any payment. I have been on hold with customer support for almost 2 hours at this point. It’s sad because I know others who have had good experiences with Airbnb, however I will never even attempt to use it again in my life.

title: The only constant is change
text:
I like Airbnb, but I have one major gripe about both the website and the app for hosts: too many and too frequent changes. Just when you get used to where certain functions are, they move! I end up spending way too much time trying to find things. Case in point: directions to the listing. I’ve located it again, but this is, if I’m not mistaken, the third place it’s been in the two years I’ve been with Airbnb. 

Also, the latest version of the app has an extremely annoying bug. In the monthly version of the calendar, my blocked dates are no longer visible. (They show up in the details view. Bookings display just fine in both views.) Interestingly, this happens on my iPhone 6s, but not on my husband’s iPhone 5. No amount of deleting, restarting, logging in and out etc. seems to fix the problem.

title: Pre-Judged
text:
My family and I travel regularly for business. We are new to Airbnb and have only used it one time in the past and had a decent experience. We were looking to book a stay for an upcoming business trip but we’re not allowed to book a reservation. There would have been 5 of us total (My wife and I, our childcare provider, our 3yr old and our 11month old) . 

We were denied reservations because the system deemed us a “high party risk” . When we called to get clarity around this matter we were told “the system” made this determination and there is nothing we can do but submit an appeal. We submitted an appeal but received an email saying “the details of the reservation indicate a high party risk” so the decision stands. Air Bnb suggested booking hotel rooms or private rooms through them. No thanks . Who parties with their 3yr old and 11month old ? 

Vrbo here we come

title: absolutely ridiculous
text: My 88 year old grandmother, 60 year old mother, and I stayed in an absolute nightmare of a room and already left a review for that but i just want to warn anyone wanting to use this app for their next vacation. this was supposed to be a birthday trip for my mother but ended up being a robbery of our money. we asked for a refund and got about 5% of everything we spent back. first they claimed to be unable to help me because too much time had passed but that was only because they failed to provide me with a proper process to provide the documents i had for proof. then since i was back home i had surgery scheduled and was unable to deal with the whole process because i was preoccupied. they were just absolutely unhelpful and horrible. never using this app again. i’m so angry i don’t even feel like typing anymore . just know that the support team seems to be completely mindless and unhelpful.
